resources.string: This application is just a wrapper for rsync. This program may be useful for people that want to implement a simple rsync solution in their LAN. The interface is just a front-end for the rsync command that runs in the background.

How to use this Application
 1.Server Settings:
	a.Server IP Address: Fill in the server's listening LAN address (e.g 192.168.1.100). Next, type the listening port (default 873). If you leave this field empty the default port will be used. 
	b.Rsync User: Enter the user that is permitted to connect to the rsync server. 
	c.Rsync Server Mod: Type the name of the rsync module that you want to connect to. 

2.Local Settings: 
	a. Add Path: Select the folder that you want to sync with the rsync server. 

3. Select the rsync options

-v, increase verbosity 
	 -q, suppress non-error messages 
	 -a, archive mode; equals -rlptgoD 
	 -z, compress file data during the transfer 
	 -r, recurse into directories 
	 -u, skip files that are newer on the receiver 
	 -p, preserve permissions 
	 -o, preserve owner (super-user only) 
	 -g, preserve group 
	 -t, preserve modification times 
	 -n, perform a trial run with no changes made (dry run) 
	 -m, prune empty directory chains from file-list 
	 -O, omit directories from --times

This section is addressed to experienced users of the utility, where any rsync configuration using any option described in rsync man page, can be used.

 In this form, there are three fields that must be completed: Options (without the leading "-"), Arg1 and Arg2.

 Any rsync configuration takes three arguments to complete. For your reference check the following part from rsync documentation:


 Local: rsync [OPTION...] SRC... [DEST]



Access via remote shell:

 Pull: 
 rsync [OPTION...] [USER@]HOST:SRC... [DEST]

 Push: 
 rsync [OPTION...] SRC... [USER@]HOST:DEST



Access via rsync daemon:
 Pull: 
 rsync [OPTION...] [USER@]HOST::SRC... [DEST]

 rsync [OPTION...] rsync://[USER@]HOST[:PORT]/SRC... [DEST]

 Push: 
 rsync [OPTION...] SRC... [USER@]HOST::DEST

 rsync [OPTION...] SRC... rsync://[USER@]HOST[:PORT]/DEST



So, Arg1 can be the expression for the SRC or DEST in case of pulling, and the Arg2 will be the Expression for DEST or SRC respectively. 

 Example: 
 Options: avzhe ssh --progress 
 Arg1: /storage/emulated/0/DCIM 
 Arg2: root@192.168.0.100:/backups 

 For more info regarding the rsync documentation visit: https://download.samba.org/pub/rsync/rsync.html

Before using rsync in remote shell configuration, passwordless ssh logins to the remote server must be setup. 

 The user can do it manually or use a third-party app or use the "Generate SSH Keypair" button on this form. 

 You need to import the generated public key /rsa_key.pub to your server.
Recommendations for people to contact based on your message history
Display a Notification When an Rsync Job Starts
